channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: White House deletes racist Trump post depicting Obamas as apes
item.description: A video shared on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted Democratic former President Barack Obama and first lady Michelle Obama as apes was deleted on Friday, following criticism that the US president's post evoked racist imagery long used to dehumanise people of African descent. "A Whi

item.title: Suicide bomber kills 31 in Shi’ite mosque in Pakistan’s capital, officials say
item.description: A suicide bomber killed at least 31 people and wounded almost 170 others during Friday prayers in a Shi’ite Muslim mosque in Pakistan’s capital Islamabad, police and government officials said. Images from the site showed bloodied bodies lying on the carpeted mosque floor surrounded by

item.title: Explosion at illegal coal mine kills at least 18 in India’s Meghalaya
item.description: An explosion ripped through an illegal coal mine in India’s northeastern state of Meghalaya on Thursday, killing at least 18 workers and injuring another, authorities said. Police officer Vikash Kumar said rescue teams recovered 18 bodies from the site of the explosion in a remote area of th

item.title: US, Russia to reestablish military-to-military talks
item.description: The US military said that Washington and Moscow on Thursday agreed to reestablish high level military-to-military dialogue, following talks in Abu Dhabi, a move which could signal a move towards normalising some ties between the United States and Russia. The United States halted military-to-milita

item.title: Cubans under siege as US stranglehold sets in
Cuba declares "international emergency" in response to US executive order
Venezuela announces amnesty bill that could lead to mass release of political prisoners
Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
30 killed in US from effects of winter storm
Over 11,400 flights cancelled as massive winter storm hits US
US judge blocks Trump administration's push to end legal status of 8,400 migrants
US Border Patrol shooting in Minneapolis kills ICU nurse, family says
Guatemalan prison hostages freed
Trump wants nations to pay $1b to stay on his peace board, report says
AP obtains documents showing Venezuela’s Delcy Rodríguez has long been on DEA radar
Venezuela’s new leader moves to tighten her grip on power
Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of late Libyan leader, has been killed, sources say
item.description: The most prominent son of late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, has been killed, sources close to the family, his lawyer Khaled el-Zaydi and Libyan media said on Tuesday. Details surrounding the circumstances of his death were not immediately clear. While Saif al-Islam is wel

item.title: Revolutionary Guards have no plan to hold military exercises in Gulf: Iran official
item.description: The naval forces of Iran's Revolutionary Guards have no plan to carry out live-fire exercises in the Strait of Hormuz as reported by some media outlets earlier this week, an Iranian official told Reuters on Sunday. Iran's state-run Press TV reported on Thursday that the force would carry out the e

item.title: Saudi ministry suspends Umrah contracts of 1,800 foreign agencies
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Hajj and Umrah has suspended contracts with about 1,800 foreign Umrah travel agencies, giving them 10 days to resolve compliance issues identified during a routine performance review. The action affects agencies operating in the Umrah sector out of an estimated tot

item.title: India dismisses Epstein claims involving PM Modi as baseless
item.description: The Indian government has rejected claims made in newly released emails from the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, calling them baseless assertions that deserve no credibility. In a statement issued on Saturday, the Ministry of External Affairs said the references in the e

item.title: Militant attacks kill 33 in Pakistan’s Balochistan; security forces kill 92 assailants
item.description: A wave of coordinated suicide bombings and gun attacks across Pakistan's southwestern Balochistan province killed at least 33 people on Saturday, while security forces killed 92 militants in retaliatory operations, the military said. Among the dead were 18 civilians and 15 members of the security

item.title: Pakistan says 67 militants killed after coordinated attacks in Balochistan
item.description: At least 67 militants were killed on Saturday as they battled Pakistan's security forces in multiple cities across the southwestern province of Balochistan, four security officials told Reuters. Some 10 police and security personnel and 11 civilians were also killed during the orchestrated militan

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 12 in Gaza, health ministry says
item.description: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza killed at least 12 people, the Palestinian health ministry said, with children reported to be among the fatalities in the latest violence rattling a tenuous ceasefire. One airstrike hit an apartment in Gaza City killing three children and two women, according to a family

item.title: Thousands flee northwest Pakistan after mosques warn of possible military action
item.description: Tens of thousands of people have fled a remote mountainous region in northwestern Pakistan in recent weeks, residents said, after warnings broadcast from mosques urged families to evacuate ahead of a possible military action against Islamist militants. Residents of the Tirah Valley, in the Pakista

item.title: Thousands marched for democracy in Myanmar. Some died in prison
item.description: Shwe Theingi was instantly drawn to Wutt Yee Aung when they met at the start of their second year at Myanmar's Dagon University in 2019. The 19-year-old zoology major stood out with her boyish clothes, short hair and a friendly but outspoken personality, Shwe Theingi said. The two young women, who

item.title: Afghanistan launches $100 million food security programme as crisis deepens
item.description: Afghanistan will roll out a $100 million food security project, the United Nations said on Thursday, as it contends with a worsening hunger crisis driven by mass deportations of Afghans from neighbouring states, foreign aid cuts and economic crisis. Afghanistan's humanitarian situation is deterior

item.title: Calcutta HC orders land for BSF fencing
item.description: The Calcutta High Court has directed the West Bengal government to allocate land to the Border Security Force (BSF) for the construction of barbed-wire fencing along the Bangladesh border. The order, issued on Tuesday, requires the state to hand over land in nine border districts by Mar 31, accord

item.title: Over 70000 flee northwestern Pakistan over fears of military operation
item.description: More than 70,000 people, mostly women and children, have fled a remote region in northwestern Pakistan bordering Afghanistan over uncertainty of a military operation against the Pakistani Taliban, residents and officials said Tuesday. Pakistan's Defense Minister Khawaja Mohammad Asif has denied th
